description: Gets information about an Amazon Kendra index.

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: The identifier of the index you want to get information on.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the index.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The identifier of the index.

nested_items.name: Edition
nested_items.description: The Amazon Kendra edition used for the index. You decide the edition when you create the index.

nested_items.name: RoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that gives Amazon Kendra permission to write to your Amazon CloudWatch logs.

nested_items.name: ServerSideEncryptionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The identifier of the KMS customer master key (CMK) that is used to encrypt your data. Amazon Kendra doesn't support asymmetric CMKs.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The identifier of the KMS key. Amazon Kendra doesn't support asymmetric keys.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the index. When the value is ACTIVE, the index is ready for use. If the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains a message that explains why.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The description for the index.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the index was created.

nested_items.name: UpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The Unix timestamp when the index was last updated.

nested_items.name: DocumentMetadataConfigurations
nested_items.description: Configuration information for document metadata or fields. Document metadata are fields or attributes associated with your documents. For example, the company department name associated with each document.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the index field.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The data type of the index field.

nested_items.name: Relevance
nested_items.description: Provides tuning parameters to determine how the field affects the search results.

nested_items.name: Freshness
nested_items.description: Indicates that this field determines how 'fresh' a document is. For example, if document 1 was created on November 5, and document 2 was created on October 31, document 1 is 'fresher' than document 2. Only applies to DATE fields.

nested_items.name: Importance
nested_items.description: The relative importance of the field in the search. Larger numbers provide more of a boost than smaller numbers.

nested_items.name: Duration
nested_items.description: Specifies the time period that the boost applies to. For example, to make the boost apply to documents with the field value within the last month, you would use '2628000s'. Once the field value is beyond the specified range, the effect of the boost drops off. The higher the importance, the faster the effect drops off. If you don't specify a value, the default is 3 months. The value of the field is a numeric string followed by the character 's', for example '86400s' for one day, or '604800s' for one week.

nested_items.name: RankOrder
nested_items.description: Determines how values should be interpreted.

nested_items.name: ValueImportanceMap
nested_items.description: A list of values that should be given a different boost when they appear in the result list. For example, if you are boosting a field called 'department', query terms that match the department field are boosted in the result. However, you can add entries from the department field to boost documents with those values higher.
(string) ---
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: Facetable
nested_items.description: Indicates that the field can be used to create search facets, a count of results for each value in the field. The default is false .

nested_items.name: Searchable
nested_items.description: Determines whether the field is used in the search. If the Searchable field is true, you can use relevance tuning to manually tune how Amazon Kendra weights the field in the search. The default is true for string fields and false for number and date fields.

nested_items.name: Displayable
nested_items.description: Determines whether the field is returned in the query response. The default is true.

nested_items.name: Sortable
nested_items.description: Determines whether the field can be used to sort the results of a query. If you specify sorting on a field that does not have Sortable set to true, Amazon Kendra returns an exception. The default is false.

nested_items.name: IndexStatistics
nested_items.description: Provides information about the number of FAQ questions and answers and the number of text documents indexed.

nested_items.name: FaqStatistics
nested_items.description: The number of question and answer topics in the index.

nested_items.name: IndexedQuestionAnswersCount
nested_items.description: The total number of FAQ questions and answers for an index.

nested_items.name: TextDocumentStatistics
nested_items.description: The number of text documents indexed.

nested_items.name: IndexedTextDocumentsCount
nested_items.description: The number of text documents indexed.

nested_items.name: IndexedTextBytes
nested_items.description: The total size, in bytes, of the indexed documents.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: When the Status field value is FAILED, the ErrorMessage field contains a message that explains why.

nested_items.name: CapacityUnits
nested_items.description: For Enterprise Edition indexes, you can choose to use additional capacity to meet the needs of your application. This contains the capacity units used for the index. A query or document storage capacity of zero indicates that the index is using the default capacity. For more information on the default capacity for an index and adjusting this, see Adjusting capacity.

nested_items.name: StorageCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The amount of extra storage capacity for an index. A single capacity unit provides 30 GB of storage space or 100,000 documents, whichever is reached first. You can add up to 100 extra capacity units.

nested_items.name: QueryCapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The amount of extra query capacity for an index and GetQuerySuggestions capacity.

nested_items.name: UserTokenConfigurations
nested_items.description: The user token configuration for the Amazon Kendra index.

nested_items.name: JwtTokenTypeConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the JWT token type configuration.

nested_items.name: KeyLocation
nested_items.description: The location of the key.

nested_items.name: URL
nested_items.description: The signing key URL.

nested_items.name: SecretManagerArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (arn) of the secret.

nested_items.name: UserNameAttributeField
nested_items.description: The user name attribute field.

nested_items.name: GroupAttributeField
nested_items.description: The group attribute field.

nested_items.name: Issuer
nested_items.description: The issuer of the token.

nested_items.name: ClaimRegex
nested_items.description: The regular expression that identifies the claim.

nested_items.name: JsonTokenTypeConfiguration
nested_items.description: Information about the JSON token type configuration.

nested_items.name: UserNameAttributeField
nested_items.description: The user name attribute field.

nested_items.name: GroupAttributeField
nested_items.description: The group attribute field.

nested_items.name: UserContextPolicy
nested_items.description: The user context policy for the Amazon Kendra index.

nested_items.name: UserGroupResolutionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Whether you have enabled IAM Identity Center identity source for your users and groups. This is useful for user context filtering, where search results are filtered based on the user or their group access to documents.

nested_items.name: UserGroupResolutionMode
nested_items.description: The identity store provider (mode) you want to use to get users and groups. IAM Identity Center is currently the only available mode. Your users and groups must exist in an IAM Identity Center identity source in order to use this mode.
